availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Gillon (Bath County, Kentucky, student and private (U.S.A.))

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Ireland native. Son of James Gillon and Ellen Gillon. Student in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as private from November 6, 1862 to September 16, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 67A.
Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veterans Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 741.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 86.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 379.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0129.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Roll 194, Application 725517, Certificate 666297.
"John Gillon (1845-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial 44096257, accessed September 27, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/44096257.
